pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:0.4: The sub-chapter on hands on hips
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:0.5: 22. The second training rule on hands on hips
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with their hands on their hips. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.3.1: “‘I will not sit in inhabited areas with my hands on my hips,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.4: One should not sit in an inhabited area with one’s hands on one’s hips.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area with one or both hands on his hips, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.11: if he has entered his dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.15: The second training rule is finished.
